title: Annual Park Evaluation Scores (FY15-now)
description:
Pursuant to San Francisco Charter § F1.102 of Appendix F, the San Francisco Park Evaluation Program (SFPEP) has regularly evaluated and assessed the conditions of all San Francisco civic plazas and squares, mini parks, neighborhood parks and playgrounds, parkways and regional parks since 2005. The City Services Auditor division of the Controller’s Office and Recreation & Parks Department (RPD) staff conduct quarterly evaluations.  The Controller’s Office use the results to communicate the condition of San Francisco’s parks to RPD management and park staff, elected officials, and the public, and to improve park conditions by efficient resource allocation and improved maintenance. Starting with fiscal year 2015 with an updated maintenance evaluation standard, the data are collected and maintained in a source system within the Recreation & Parks Department. 

The park evaluation data are summarized in this dataset here.

To see more details on each park's scores, please visit the new public dashboard: https://www.sf.gov/san-francisco-park-maintenance-scores

columns.name: FY
columns.description: The fiscal year (FY) during which the park was evaluated.  FY2024 starts July 1, 2023 and ends on June 30, 2024.

columns.name: Park
columns.description: Name of the park evaluated.  There are about 170 public parks.

columns.name: Park Type
columns.description: Type of park i.e. neighborhood park or playground, regional park, mini park, parkway, civic plaza or square.

columns.name: Park Score
columns.description: Each park's maintenance score calculated as an annualized percentage from 0 to 1 (or 0% to 100%).  For more information please refer to Appendix 2 of our FY24 annual report https://www.sf.gov/sites/default/files/2024-11/FY%202024%20Park%20Maintenance%20Standards%20Evaluation%20Report.pdf

columns.name: PSA
columns.description: The Park Service Area (PSA) the park falls within.  PSAs are designated by RPD for internal use.

columns.name: Supervisor District
columns.description: The supervisor district the park falls within.  Please refer to this map https://data.sfgov.org/Geographic-Locations-and-Boundaries/Map-of-Current-Supervisor-Districts/tadv-nifg
